medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute bright red blood per rectum
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was in good health until 2 days prior to admission when she noted small amounts of mucous that was blood-tinged in her stool. Today at 3 PM, she experienced a large volume of bright red blood per rectum, tinging the toilet water red and containing clots. She has had approximately 10 bloody bowel movements. Patient reports feeling lightheaded when getting up quickly and mild discomfort in the lower abdomen. No fevers or chills reported.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia, Ankylosing spondylitis s/p c4/5 C6/7 fusion, S/P CCK, Patent foramen Ovale
